description.narrative: Overall objective: To create equal opportunities for vulnerable people to access to natural resources and to enhance land governance at levels in term of effectiveness, efficiency, responsiveness, accountability and transparency. Component 1: Legal aid to people who lose land or in land disputes Objective: To fight against social injustice through provision of legal information and a legal aid for limited resource farmers and disadvantageous communities dealing with protecting their land use rights andbenefits. Output 1: People who lose their land or in land disputes access to legal support services. Output 2: Grass-roots staffs are capable of providing legal aids for local people. Component 2: Policy advocacy Objective: To enable the policy makershear the voice and perspectives of vulnerable people (farmers, poor and ethnic people) and experts relating to agriculture and forestry land use and management to develop better policies. Output 1: Researches# results on cases of land loss and compensation are disseminated to policy makers and publicize to the public. Output 2: Policy makers take vulnerable groups# opinions and wishes into account in the policy making process. Target Area and Beneficiaries The Land Governance Program (LGP) now seekstointegrate interventions at grass roots levels (village,commune, district and province) and to provide evidence for national level advocacy work. The LGP will focus on beneficiaries who are farmers and ethnic minority people (vulnerable groups) and targetat agriculture land. For the first objective, two provinces are selected as the program#s target areas. The program will work in two poor communes in one district per each province where local people depend much on agricultural production and/ or bothagricultural and forestry land. Target communes will be areas that the percentage of farmers must account for at least 70% of the total population. It is better if have agriculture land were or will be recovered by the government in these communes because people here are direct affected land users. Through the LGP, land users will have more opportunities to access to legal information and receive legal advices and assistance of land problems. Therefore, they would havemore power and voice in defend their legitimate land use rights from the land acquisition, also improve their livelihoods and diversify their livelihood options. Local government staff and mass organization members are also direct beneficiaries of the program. They will receive training courses and attend workshops to enhance their capacities, knowledge and skills of legal aid and land administration. For the second objective, Oxfam will be a bridge to connect different perspectives of land issues from grass roots levels to policy makers through researches so that both direct and indirect beneficiaries are research institutes, universities, local authorities and policy-makers who take part in research activities and policy dialogues. Target areas for researches selected will be provinces withgood or bad practices of the land acquisition process and compensation (such as Nam Dinh, Da Dang, Bac Giang provinces/cities, etc.) in order to find out good recommendations for the policy-makers.

participating-org.narrative:
HISTORY
Hoa Binh FU is a provincial affiliate of the Vietnam Farmer Union established on October 14, 1930 by the Vietnam CommunistParty. HBFU now has 129,000 members. Its annual fund resource is VND7.2 billion. Since 2008, HBFU has been cooperatingwith Oxfam Belgium and ADDA (from Denmark) in programs supporting local farmers developing agricultural production. # HBFU has cooperated with enterprises and organizations to conduct both short and long-term vocational training for famers based on their needs. These trainingcourses have met farmers# needs and contributed to job creation for them; # HBFU has advised the Provincial People#s Committee to implement the project on supporting interest for farmers to buy machines and tools for production. As a result, the farmers have beensupported to buy 405 machines and with VND 1.6 billion of interest; # HBFU has signed cooperation with enterprises inside and outside the province to implement programmes on selling goods with stable prices in remote areas and allowing its members to buy fertilizers and animal food by credit; # HBFU has cooperated with the banking system to establish 9,339 loan groups, which have provided loans for more than 245,160 rounds of members. Currently, the total amount of capital for loans is VND 9.76 billion for 1,907 farmer households. This source of capital has helped its members in production, doing business and creating high income. Many households havecome out of poverty thanks to this; In particular, after 6 years ofimplementing the development program funded by Oxfam Belgium, Hoa Binh Farmers Union has successfuly achieved the following results: # Established and sustain 24 production groups for local variety production in 9 communes in 3 districts Tan Lac, Lac Son and Kim Boi. All production groups understood and applied technologies and successfully carried out 4 studies (breeding line selection; rehabiliation; comparison and experiment). Currently 23 potential lines have been selected for seed and suitable withdifferent ecological areas. # Local variety program in Hoa Binh has importantly contributed to change awareness and attitudes of farmers about seed and the role of farmers in agricultural development. Starting from the farmers only passively relied on supports from the state, and now they are actively linking together in seed production and consumption for their own demands and for the communities. Local seeds are crucial to farmers especially poor and close poor farmers. Poor farmers in Hoa Binh can easily access to local seed with reasonable price for their production, reducing risks in fallow land due to high prices of imported seeds. # Through conducting studies, farmer groups have contributed to protect precious genes of local seed that have been lost in Hoa Binh and contributed to ecological environment reservation. # Currently supporting 3 cooperatives developed from seed production groups # Farmer groups have been able to make recommendations on their initiatives to local authorities and relatedagencies in order to asking for supports on mechanism and resources # Having able to mobilize supports and resources from external organizaitons to cooperate in increasingly supporting farmers
